alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Columbus; Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brunswick, southwestern Columbus and central Horry Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Myrtle Beach, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Myrtle Beach, North Myrtle Beach, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Myrtle Beach Airport, Little River, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Cherry Grove Inlet, Red Hill, Socastee, Iredell, Carolina Shores, Tabor City, Loris, Calabash, Bethel, Hickory Grove, Makatoka and Exum. This includes the following highways... US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 29. SC Highway 31 between mile markers 5 and 24. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 13 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
